title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction

meta.title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction

sentences.text: 04/21/2022 G DATA Blog
sentences.html: 04/21/2022 G DATA Blog

chapters.title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction

sentences.text: We identified more than 400 samples for Ginzo stealer within 10 days since 20th March and the numbers are rising. What is behind the free stealer?
sentences.html: We identified more than 400 samples for Ginzo stealer within 10 days since 20th March and the numbers are rising. What is behind the free stealer?

sentences.text: Reading time: 3 min (786 words)
sentences.html: Reading time: 3 min (786 words)

sentences.text: We discovered and announced Ginzo stealer[1] on March 24, 2022. A Youtube video, discovered by @3xp0rtblog, showcases the first release. It was uploaded on 4th of March.
sentences.html: We discovered and announced Ginzo stealer[1] on March 24, 2022. A Youtube video, discovered by @3xp0rtblog, showcases the first release. It was uploaded on 4th of March.

sentences.text: The description below the video states that the stealer is provided for free, which is most likely a marketing technique to get criminal buyers hooked.
sentences.html: The description below the video states that the stealer is provided for free, which is most likely a marketing technique to get criminal buyers hooked.

sentences.text: If that is a marketing technique, it has worked well for the criminals. Just counting the samples we saw between 20th and 30th of March, we found more than 400 Ginzo stealer binaries on VirusTotal.
sentences.html: If that is a marketing technique, it has worked well for the criminals. Just counting the samples we saw between 20th and 30th of March, we found more than 400 Ginzo stealer binaries on VirusTotal.

sentences.text: Ginzo's Telegram channel states that the stealer is for sale by now.
sentences.html: Ginzo's Telegram channel states that the stealer is for sale by now.

sentences.text: Ginzo stealer is obfuscated with ConfuserEx resulting in error messages when trying to decompile the code. That is because the type initializer .cctor decrypts the actual code on the fly. It also initializes data required for string decryption.
sentences.html: Ginzo stealer is obfuscated with ConfuserEx resulting in error messages when trying to decompile the code. That is because the type initializer .cctor decrypts the actual code on the fly. It also initializes data required for string decryption.

sentences.text: Automatic deobfuscation with tools like de4dot is not sufficient anymore. A combination of debugging (to obtain the decrypted code and strings), static analysis and manual deobfuscation is necessary to obtain readable code.
sentences.html: Automatic deobfuscation with tools like de4dot is not sufficient anymore. A combination of debugging (to obtain the decrypted code and strings), static analysis and manual deobfuscation is necessary to obtain readable code.

sentences.text: .cctor decrypts the actual code
Ginzo stealer first downloads the following additional libraries from its C&C server:
sentences.html: Ginzo stealer first downloads the following additional libraries from its C&C server:

sentences.text: Newtonsoft.Json.dll<crlf>BouncyCastle.Crypto.dll<crlf>SQLite.Interop.dll for x86 and x64<crlf>System.Data.SQLite.dll<crlf>DotNetZip.dll
sentences.html:
• Newtonsoft.Json.dll
  • BouncyCastle.Crypto.dll
  • SQLite.Interop.dll for x86 and x64
  • System.Data.SQLite.dll
  • DotNetZip.dll

sentences.text: Due to improper exception handling the stealer crashes some time later if these libraries cannot be downloaded.
sentences.html: Due to improper exception handling the stealer crashes some time later if these libraries cannot be downloaded.

sentences.text: The stealer requests a ginzolist.txt from the C&C server. This text file contains addresses of additional download locations for executables. In our tests the file contained two entries that instruct Ginzo to download antiwm.exe[2] and generation.exe[3]. The file antivm.exe is a malicious coinminer and generation.exe is another .NET based stealer, specializing on Discord tokens. Both of these files are packed.
sentences.html: The stealer requests a ginzolist.txt from the C&C server. This text file contains addresses of additional download locations for executables. In our tests the file contained two entries that instruct Ginzo to download antiwm.exe[2] and generation.exe[3]. The file antivm.exe is a malicious coinminer and generation.exe is another .NET based stealer, specializing on Discord tokens. Both of these files are packed.

sentences.text: Ginzo creates a folder named GinzoFolder in %LOCALAPPDATA% (see picture below). It stores all the extracted system data there, like screenshots, credentials, cookies, telegram data, and cryptocurrency wallets. The stealer creates a file named System.txt to store generic system information, which includes the IP address, operating system, username, computername, screen resolution, graphics card, processor, RAM, launch time and the Ginzo stealer telegram channel. The stealer also stores a datetime value in ChromeUploadTime.txt for making sure that the stolen data is not sent too often to the threat actor.
sentences.html: Ginzo creates a folder named GinzoFolder in %LOCALAPPDATA% (see picture below). It stores all the extracted system data there, like screenshots, credentials, cookies, telegram data, and cryptocurrency wallets. The stealer creates a file named System.txt to store generic system information, which includes the IP address, operating system, username, computername, screen resolution, graphics card, processor, RAM, launch time and the Ginzo stealer telegram channel. The stealer also stores a datetime value in ChromeUploadTime.txt for making sure that the stolen data is not sent too often to the threat actor.

sentences.text: A listing of GinzoFolder contents and contained data is in the IoC section at the bottom.
sentences.html: A listing of GinzoFolder contents and contained data is in the IoC section at the bottom.

sentences.text: Contents of GinzoFolder which saves all the extracted data from an infected system (click to enlarge)
Content of System.txt which collects general system information (click to enlarge)
Ginzo obtains the following data from the system:
sentences.html: Ginzo obtains the following data from the system:

sentences.text: Telegram sessions<crlf>Opera, Chrome, Opera GX, Firefox cookies and passwords<crlf>all Desktop files<crlf>Discord tokens<crlf>cryptocurrency wallets<crlf>general system data
sentences.html:
• Telegram sessions
  • Opera, Chrome, Opera GX, Firefox cookies and passwords
  • all Desktop files
  • Discord tokens
  • cryptocurrency wallets
  • general system data

sentences.text: The stealer then contacts the C&C and starts with sending statistics about the stolen data:
sentences.html: The stealer then contacts the C&C and starts with sending statistics about the stolen data:

sentences.text: hxxps://nominally.ru/g1nzo.php?data=1148674342&countc=<cookie_count>&countp=<password_count>&country=<country>&ip=<ip_address>&countw=<cryptowallet_count>
sentences.html: hxxps://nominally.ru/g1nzo.php?data=1148674342&countc=<cookie_count>&countp=<password_count>&country=<country>&ip=<ip_address>&countw=<cryptowallet_count>

sentences.text: The digits that are sent via the data parameter are likely some kind of ID for the stealer binary.
sentences.html: The digits that are sent via the data parameter are likely some kind of ID for the stealer binary.

sentences.text: Ginzo saves the files from GinzoFolder into ginzoarchive.zip and sends the archive to the C&C server.
sentences.html: Ginzo saves the files from GinzoFolder into ginzoarchive.zip and sends the archive to the C&C server.

sentences.text: Main routine for data stealing (side note for detection engineers: This shows manually deobfuscated code, including the naming of the methods, and is not fit for detection creation) (click to enlarge)

Ginzo sends stolen data to the server (side note for detection engineers: This shows manually deobfuscated code, including the naming of the methods, and is not fit for detection creation) (click to enlarge)

Ginzo is a full fledged stealer that has become widely used in a relatively short amount of time. It is yet another stealer that we may have to deal with in the following years if the Ginzo threat actors stay in the game.
sentences.html: Ginzo is a full fledged stealer that has become widely used in a relatively short amount of time. It is yet another stealer that we may have to deal with in the following years if the Ginzo threat actors stay in the game.

sentences.text: When criminals provide something for free, it is most likely not charity. It may be used to improve reputation, to hook future buyers, and in this case also to get stolen data while letting others do the job of spreading the malware, since all the data is funneled to the server of the Ginzo threat actors.
sentences.html: When criminals provide something for free, it is most likely not charity. It may be used to improve reputation, to hook future buyers, and in this case also to get stolen data while letting others do the job of spreading the malware, since all the data is funneled to the server of the Ginzo threat actors.
